KH.content: entire discourse on khōra, every yet-to-come history of interpretations, included in advance, this X receives all, teleologically programs history of hermeneutics[?], is that a history?
KH.linkedContent: entire discourse on khōra, every yet-to-come history of interpretations, included in advance, this X receives all, teleologically programs history of hermeneutics[?], is that a history?

KH.content: Derrida less concerned w/ art of Plato [re: mises en abyme of khōra and politics] but in a constraint, a programme, the being-programme of the programme, the being-logical of logic: Plato apprehends them as such, though in a dream, put en abyme
KH.linkedContent: Derrida less concerned w/ art of Plato [re: mises en abyme of khōra and politics] but in a constraint, a programme, the being-programme of the programme, the being-logical of logic: Plato apprehends them as such, though in a dream, put en abyme

KH.content: Socrates puts himself in place of khōra (place itself, irreplaceable and unplaceable place), thus makes them, makes us talk, implacably [no choice] [see pp. 121-22 Socrates seems to program discourse of his addressees, who will speak?]
KH.linkedContent: Socrates puts himself in place of khōra (place itself, irreplaceable and unplaceable place), thus makes them, makes us talk, implacably [no choice] [see pp. 121-22 Socrates seems to program discourse of his addressees, who will speak?]

GT.content: the foreseeable, programmed, conditioned, expected, counted on, necessary cannot be a gift or event
GT.linkedContent: the foreseeable, programmed, conditioned, expected, counted on, necessary cannot be a gift or event

GT.content: event, gift, must be structured by aleatory, remaining unforeseeable w/out being kept so
GT.linkedContent: event, gift, must be structured by aleatory, remaining unforeseeable w/out being kept so

FK.content: technical, automatic, machine-like [the possibility of faith, its very chance], a chance that entails risk of radical evil, otherwise it would simply be pure know-how, pure knowledge, annulment of future, programme, proof, predictability, providence
FK.linkedContent: technical, automatic, machine-like [the possibility of faith, its very chance], a chance that entails risk of radical evil, otherwise it would simply be pure know-how, pure knowledge, annulment of future, programme, proof, predictability, providence

POR.content: new responsibility of community of thought w/out secured frontier btwn basic & end-oriented research (entre recherche fondamentale et recherche finalisée) > rethink community, institution, and all ruses, tâche infinie, de la raison finalisante > paths by which apparently disinterested research can by reinvested by all sorts of programs
POR.linkedContent: new responsibility of community of thought w/out secured frontier btwn basic & end-oriented research (entre recherche fondamentale et recherche finalisée) > rethink community, institution, and all ruses, tâche infinie, de la raison finalisante > paths by which apparently disinterested research can by reinvested by all sorts of programs

POR.content: “thinking” requires both principle of reason and what’s beyond it, both archē and an-archy > decision [of thought] always risks the worst, to claim to erase the risk by institutional program is to create a barricade against a future
POR.linkedContent: “thinking” requires both principle of reason and what’s beyond it, both archē and an-archy > decision [of thought] always risks the worst, to claim to erase the risk by institutional program is to create a barricade against a future

A.content: to protect decision or responsibility by knowledge, theoretical assurance, is to transform this experience into deployment of program
A.linkedContent: to protect decision or responsibility by knowledge, theoretical assurance, is to transform this experience into deployment of program

A.content: but, should not abandon programs, they are the guardrail of a responsibility to whose calling they remain radically heterogenous
A.linkedContent: but, should not abandon programs, they are the guardrail of a responsibility to whose calling they remain radically heterogenous

PP.content: pharmakon is but a formula learned by heart, dead, rigid knowledge shut up (enfermé) in biblia, foreign to living knowledge and dialectic
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon is but a formula learned by heart, dead, rigid knowledge shut up (enfermé) in biblia, foreign to living knowledge and dialectic

PAS.content: risk of interruption is run, programmed in the night, by the récit
PAS.linkedContent: risk of interruption is run, programmed in the night, by the récit

POOF.content: program, a possible that is only possible (non-impossible), w/out perhaps, process w/out event [no future]
POOF.linkedContent: program, a possible that is only possible (non-impossible), w/out perhaps, process w/out event [no future]

POOF.content: one must resist the temptation to keep (garder) its chance, never let it become program, never a grounding on virtue of perhaps
POOF.linkedContent: one must resist the temptation to keep (garder) its chance, never let it become program, never a grounding on virtue of perhaps

POOF.content: irresponsible application of a program determines the undecidable (counts on assurance of intelligibility), depriving it of what would make it a sovereign, free decision [?]
POOF.linkedContent: irresponsible application of a program determines the undecidable (counts on assurance of intelligibility), depriving it of what would make it a sovereign, free decision [?]

OH.content: we must not forget programs that do not forget us [re: Eurocentrism, anti-Eurocentrism]
OH.linkedContent: we must not forget programs that do not forget us [re: Eurocentrism, anti-Eurocentrism]

OH.content: when a certain knowledge opens up path in advance—decision is already made: irresponsibly, w/ good conscience, one applies the program
OH.linkedContent: when a certain knowledge opens up path in advance—decision is already made: irresponsibly, w/ good conscience, one applies the program

OH.content: following program—application of know-how > ethics & politics become a technology, no longer order of practical reason or decision, begins to be irresponsible
OH.linkedContent: following program—application of know-how > ethics & politics become a technology, no longer order of practical reason or decision, begins to be irresponsible

SH.content: [Derrida comes very close here to a dialectic of program/event?]
SH.linkedContent: [Derrida comes very close here to a dialectic of program/event?]

F.content: Torok and Abraham’s method, goes beyond anticipations of a program: introduced an essential déportment (unruliness) [re: “transphenomenology,” relay, conversion]
F.linkedContent: Torok and Abraham’s method, goes beyond anticipations of a program: introduced an essential déportment (unruliness) [re: “transphenomenology,” relay, conversion]

F.content: foreign style of Abraham and Torok avoids reassuring programs (this foreignness is attached to the Thing they’re occupied w/)
F.linkedContent: foreign style of Abraham and Torok avoids reassuring programs (this foreignness is attached to the Thing they’re occupied w/)

F.content: [how the program (market, rates) is inevitable but as a place to exhume]
F.linkedContent: [how the program (market, rates) is inevitable but as a place to exhume]

FWT.content: despite its “subversion,” Derrida also sees price structuralism had to pay, its somnambulism, naiveté, the sterilizing, precipitous, dogmatic elements of its program
FWT.linkedContent: despite its “subversion,” Derrida also sees price structuralism had to pay, its somnambulism, naiveté, the sterilizing, precipitous, dogmatic elements of its program

FWT.content: there’s necessity for secondary effects of program (programmatic economy & strategy), but in the first/last instance, what is to be done is invented/inaugurated, must come w/out program
FWT.linkedContent: there’s necessity for secondary effects of program (programmatic economy & strategy), but in the first/last instance, what is to be done is invented/inaugurated, must come w/out program

FWT.content: New International must seek unheard of figures [I cannot define this form], not opposed to existence of parties, but “Party” form is no longer the major form of political struggle
FWT.linkedContent: New International must seek unheard of figures [I cannot define this form], not opposed to existence of parties, but “Party” form is no longer the major form of political struggle

DS.content: roll die in hymen, write, seminal spurt: hasard selon le programme génétique > limited to 6 surfaces [each guarding chance]
DS.linkedContent: roll die in hymen, write, seminal spurt: hasard selon le programme génétique > limited to 6 surfaces [each guarding chance]

ROP.content: sans ce double bind et sans l'épreuve de l'aporie qu'il détermine, w/out its thousands and thousands of knots of passion, all would be program, no event/decision/place would ever take place (double bind can be “pathological,” but no more than pathetic figures of death)
ROP.linkedContent: sans ce double bind et sans l'épreuve de l'aporie qu'il détermine, w/out its thousands and thousands of knots of passion, all would be program, no event/decision/place would ever take place (double bind can be “pathological,” but no more than pathetic figures of death)

ROP.content: only those who work undergo the aporia, only ones who ever think, take responsibility, everyone else applies a program
ROP.linkedContent: only those who work undergo the aporia, only ones who ever think, take responsibility, everyone else applies a program

OTO.content: discourse on life/death occurs btwn logos and gramme, analogy & program, program & reproduction (since life is on the line, the trait [splitting of line] relating graphical to logical, also working btwn biological & biographical, thanatological & thanatographical)
OTO.linkedContent: discourse on life/death occurs btwn logos and gramme, analogy & program, program & reproduction (since life is on the line, the trait [splitting of line] relating graphical to logical, also working btwn biological & biographical, thanatological & thanatographical)

OTO.content: how can reactive degeneration [Nazism] exploit same utterances, rallying cries, of active forces [Übermensch]—nor did this specular ruse elude Nietzsche: is there a “programming machine”? marrying the 2 forces (family resemblances) in a set, as life (does) death? but no regional power could set limit on such a set > no ordinary “machine,” there’s “life” in it > plays w/ opposition life/death > is there a practical rewriting of the program, which would no longer be part of it? if so, would not be produced in books
OTO.linkedContent: how can reactive degeneration [Nazism] exploit same utterances, rallying cries, of active forces [Übermensch]—nor did this specular ruse elude Nietzsche: is there a “programming machine”? marrying the 2 forces (family resemblances) in a set, as life (does) death? but no regional power could set limit on such a set > no ordinary “machine,” there’s “life” in it > plays w/ opposition life/death > is there a practical rewriting of the program, which would no longer be part of it? if so, would not be produced in books

ATIA.content: one should try not to repeat oneself, it gives appearance of training (dressage), of following a program
ATIA.linkedContent: one should try not to repeat oneself, it gives appearance of training (dressage), of following a program

ATIA.content: question of response, question of question, where response to question would remain unprogrammable > abyss of “what is a response?”
ATIA.linkedContent: question of response, question of question, where response to question would remain unprogrammable > abyss of “what is a response?”

ATIA.content: from Descartes to Heidegger, nonresponse: mechanicity of programming, deficiency, lack
ATIA.linkedContent: from Descartes to Heidegger, nonresponse: mechanicity of programming, deficiency, lack

PS.content: Nietzsche: “I hate the reading idlers. / He who knoweth the reader, doeth nothing more for the reader. Another century of readers—and spirit itself will stink.”
PS.linkedContent: Nietzsche: “I hate the reading idlers. / He who knoweth the reader, doeth nothing more for the reader. Another century of readers—and spirit itself will stink.”

O.content: re: writing, Hegel does not think exteriority, repetitive autonomy of remainder > writing becomes pro-gramme, pre-scription, pre-text, the simple empirical husk (déchet) of concept
O.linkedContent: re: writing, Hegel does not think exteriority, repetitive autonomy of remainder > writing becomes pro-gramme, pre-scription, pre-text, the simple empirical husk (déchet) of concept

O.content: for Derrida, this husk is coextensive w/ whole life of discourse
O.linkedContent: for Derrida, this husk is coextensive w/ whole life of discourse

O.content: logos spermatikos, philosophy of the seed, romanticism, myth of semantic depth, genetic pro-gram [quoting from OG]
O.linkedContent: logos spermatikos, philosophy of the seed, romanticism, myth of semantic depth, genetic pro-gram [quoting from OG]

O.content: dissemination also explains itself, “the apparatus explains itself,” constitutes itself into a program (heterogeneity, absolute exteriority of seed), but one that is not formalizable, infinity of its code, sa rupture, not saturated w/ self-presence: “it is attached (tient), so to speak, to the incessant falling of a supplement to the code”
O.linkedContent: dissemination also explains itself, “the apparatus explains itself,” constitutes itself into a program (heterogeneity, absolute exteriority of seed), but one that is not formalizable, infinity of its code, sa rupture, not saturated w/ self-presence: “it is attached (tient), so to speak, to the incessant falling of a supplement to the code”

Gi.content: Derrida wonders about a reading machine (one must think of programming the machine & know how to do it) that would snare (gibier), hunt down, sexual difference in Heidegger
Gi.linkedContent: Derrida wonders about a reading machine (one must think of programming the machine & know how to do it) that would snare (gibier), hunt down, sexual difference in Heidegger

Gii.content: Heidegger’s essential propositions re: ape’s lack of hand, an empirico-dogmatic hapax, supposedly nonmetaphysical humanism > when animality is enclosed in its organico-biological programs: absolute oppositional limit which erases differences, homogenizes
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger’s essential propositions re: ape’s lack of hand, an empirico-dogmatic hapax, supposedly nonmetaphysical humanism > when animality is enclosed in its organico-biological programs: absolute oppositional limit which erases differences, homogenizes

REST.content: if police there is (and isn’t there always?) > Derrida polices too [?], “close reading,” counterpolices [?] oldest, most dogmatic, sinisterly authoritarian programs, massive meidatizing machines: pre-text of perception, of bare hands (mains nue), of real history, of living speech (vous enferme en tout hâte dans un prétendu hors-texte)
REST.linkedContent: if police there is (and isn’t there always?) > Derrida polices too [?], “close reading,” counterpolices [?] oldest, most dogmatic, sinisterly authoritarian programs, massive meidatizing machines: pre-text of perception, of bare hands (mains nue), of real history, of living speech (vous enferme en tout hâte dans un prétendu hors-texte)

DST.content: désistance (2 typical experiences) is ineluctable: 1) il faut que cela arrive: in this case, the “I,” the free subject, anticipates/precedes, is constituted w/out or before, the ineluctable event that happens to me 2) constitutive desistance of subject: something began before me, I am late, a subject marked in advance by a pre-impression, imprint—deconstitution (“I” am not the supporting basis of this imprint): still, ineluctable not genetic programs or historical determination—those would be supplemental, late determinations of ineluctable
DST.linkedContent: désistance (2 typical experiences) is ineluctable: 1) il faut que cela arrive: in this case, the “I,” the free subject, anticipates/precedes, is constituted w/out or before, the ineluctable event that happens to me 2) constitutive desistance of subject: something began before me, I am late, a subject marked in advance by a pre-impression, imprint—deconstitution (“I” am not the supporting basis of this imprint): still, ineluctable not genetic programs or historical determination—those would be supplemental, late determinations of ineluctable

PIO.content: status of invention via politics of patent, programming of patented inventions (even integrating margin of chance)—are programmed inventions still inventions? still open to future?
PIO.linkedContent: status of invention via politics of patent, programming of patented inventions (even integrating margin of chance)—are programmed inventions still inventions? still open to future?

PIO.content: the government’s aleatory margin (for invention) remains homogenous w/ calculation (programmed invention) > w/in order of the calculable: no absolute surprise, order of the same
PIO.linkedContent: the government’s aleatory margin (for invention) remains homogenous w/ calculation (programmed invention) > w/in order of the calculable: no absolute surprise, order of the same

PIO.content: but Derrida will not oppose deconstruction (not passivity), the invention of the other, to government’s program: because opposition belongs to regimen of the same
PIO.linkedContent: but Derrida will not oppose deconstruction (not passivity), the invention of the other, to government’s program: because opposition belongs to regimen of the same

PIO.content: Schelling’s invention, re: philosopher as an inventor of forms, still limited as invention of the same in guise of supplement of invention: man’s invention supplements God’s ideality: man as psyche of God, as supplying the lack in his revelation
PIO.linkedContent: Schelling’s invention, re: philosopher as an inventor of forms, still limited as invention of the same in guise of supplement of invention: man’s invention supplements God’s ideality: man as psyche of God, as supplying the lack in his revelation

PIO.content: here, invention caught in infinite amortization, rationalistic humanism, carries out God’s program; human invention as desire of/for God
PIO.linkedContent: here, invention caught in infinite amortization, rationalistic humanism, carries out God’s program; human invention as desire of/for God

TR.content: formidable effects of machinelike automaticity: an a priori, programmed “I apologize” > automatic forgiveness self-destructs w/out delay (faster than “Mission Impossible” tapes), loses its meaning, its memory, annihilates its own archive
TR.linkedContent: formidable effects of machinelike automaticity: an a priori, programmed “I apologize” > automatic forgiveness self-destructs w/out delay (faster than “Mission Impossible” tapes), loses its meaning, its memory, annihilates its own archive

WAP.content: ideological or political constraint is the real program of power, all under its sway, in essence, reproduce said program, and ward off (repoussant) everything that would remove it
WAP.linkedContent: ideological or political constraint is the real program of power, all under its sway, in essence, reproduce said program, and ward off (repoussant) everything that would remove it

WAP.content: somewhat Foucault-like vision of network of programs as profound machine, though the additional idea that this machine reinvests, reemploys, itself in each determined configuration
WAP.linkedContent: somewhat Foucault-like vision of network of programs as profound machine, though the additional idea that this machine reinvests, reemploys, itself in each determined configuration

WAP.content: pose questions, pose or posit that which does not pose or posit itself, not-thetic? this alleged neutrality constructs teaching body > no question not constrained by a program
WAP.linkedContent: pose questions, pose or posit that which does not pose or posit itself, not-thetic? this alleged neutrality constructs teaching body > no question not constrained by a program

AD.content: the instantaneous meantime of the decision (l’entretemps instantané de la décision), contretemps, hiatus, or non-response, discontinues speech and is gift of speech
AD.linkedContent: the instantaneous meantime of the decision (l’entretemps instantané de la décision), contretemps, hiatus, or non-response, discontinues speech and is gift of speech

AD.content: w/out silence, w/out non-response: simply unfold (dérouler) knowledge in a program > nothing would make us more irresponsible, nothing more totalitarian
AD.linkedContent: w/out silence, w/out non-response: simply unfold (dérouler) knowledge in a program > nothing would make us more irresponsible, nothing more totalitarian

AD.content: when not insoluble, when I know what to do (program), no decision or responsibility
AD.linkedContent: when not insoluble, when I know what to do (program), no decision or responsibility

AD.content: an abyss remains and must remain

BSi.content: anthropocentered, humanistic logic: sovereignty of Law, freedom, responsibility (response) opposed to animal fixity, program, imaginary, hard-wired, coded reaction
BSi.linkedContent: anthropocentered, humanistic logic: sovereignty of Law, freedom, responsibility (response) opposed to animal fixity, program, imaginary, hard-wired, coded reaction

BSi.content: as soon as there is absolute knowledge, everything prescribed for Sun King as a program [the king, the historian, the reader—who isn’t manipulated by history like a marionette?]
BSi.linkedContent: as soon as there is absolute knowledge, everything prescribed for Sun King as a program [the king, the historian, the reader—who isn’t manipulated by history like a marionette?]

OG.content: if cybernetics ousts metaphysical concepts soul, life, value, choice & memory, it must conserve notion of writing, trace, grammè, grapheme—until its own historico-metaphysical character is exposed [cybernetic program will be the field of writing]
OG.linkedContent: if cybernetics ousts metaphysical concepts soul, life, value, choice & memory, it must conserve notion of writing, trace, grammè, grapheme—until its own historico-metaphysical character is exposed [cybernetic program will be the field of writing]

OG.content: Leroi-Gourhan invokes notion of program, not a recourse to differentiating man from animal but understood in cybernetic sense (only intelligible via possibility of trace): far beyond “intentional consciousness,” makes grammè appear as such > a “liberation of memory” (reading machines, electronic card indexes) that enlarges differance and possibility of putting in reserve: constitutes/effaces conscious subjectivity, its logos, and its theological attributes [baby daddy]
OG.linkedContent: Leroi-Gourhan invokes notion of program, not a recourse to differentiating man from animal but understood in cybernetic sense (only intelligible via possibility of trace): far beyond “intentional consciousness,” makes grammè appear as such > a “liberation of memory” (reading machines, electronic card indexes) that enlarges differance and possibility of putting in reserve: constitutes/effaces conscious subjectivity, its logos, and its theological attributes [baby daddy]

CIR.content: beyond G.’s program, G.’s generative grammar: surprise salvation of a backfire, something in the past withdrawn (if not content at least in the sap of the idiom) from effusion of the signature > obliging G., the other, “forgetting me on pretext of understanding me”
CIR.linkedContent: beyond G.’s program, G.’s generative grammar: surprise salvation of a backfire, something in the past withdrawn (if not content at least in the sap of the idiom) from effusion of the signature > obliging G., the other, “forgetting me on pretext of understanding me”

CIR.content: nonsuturable, nonsaturable singularity of event: a perjury in G.’s machine
CIR.linkedContent: nonsuturable, nonsaturable singularity of event: a perjury in G.’s machine

CIR.content: on each date, a drop of blood, one date enough to leave geologic program behind
CIR.linkedContent: on each date, a drop of blood, one date enough to leave geologic program behind

EU.content: [CIPH] we know how inhospitable research establishment can be to themes/questions that exceed/disorganize general program > theoretic-institutional mobility must be accepted today
EU.linkedContent: [CIPH] we know how inhospitable research establishment can be to themes/questions that exceed/disorganize general program > theoretic-institutional mobility must be accepted today

EU.content: [re: CIPH] not a system (ontological ordering), not a doctrine (linked to discourses, pedagogical institutions), not a program (prescriptive, end-oriented [finalisée]) > but not empirical/rhapsodic: a “thinking” of pedagogy, each research group, each “program,” will never renounce precise specificity, autonomy, internal necessity
EU.linkedContent: [re: CIPH] not a system (ontological ordering), not a doctrine (linked to discourses, pedagogical institutions), not a program (prescriptive, end-oriented [finalisée]) > but not empirical/rhapsodic: a “thinking” of pedagogy, each research group, each “program,” will never renounce precise specificity, autonomy, internal necessity

WBH.content: there’re many undecidables, one undecidability acts as a program, programming or unprogramming a program
WBH.linkedContent: there’re many undecidables, one undecidability acts as a program, programming or unprogramming a program

WBH.content: gift not even subversive, is something else > subversion is a program, programmed destruction of certain conditions (relies on given conditions)
WBH.linkedContent: gift not even subversive, is something else > subversion is a program, programmed destruction of certain conditions (relies on given conditions)
